titles.title: Prison Security Enhancement Act of 1995
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prevent Federal prisoners from engaging in activities to increase their strength or fighting ability while in prison.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 1/13/1995--Introduced. Prison Security Enhancement Act of 1995 - Amends the Federal criminal code to direct the Bureau of Prisons to take care that prisoners under its jurisdiction do not engage in any activities designed to increase their physical strength or their fighting ability and that all equipment designed for this purpose be removed from Federal correctional facilities.
